intro: Calyptranthes ovoidea, commonly known as the oval-fruit calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its fruits are small, spherical berries that mature to a reddish color. Calyptranthes ovoidea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
